Post._content: In this post, I will focus on use of Markdown and hexo push. > 1. title level > 2. insert a link > 3. highlight the code > 4. three lists of point > 5. insert a note"[^code]" > 6. bold fonts > 7. reference > 8. edit a formula > 9. draw a flow picture > * [](#) reference website: [Cmd Markdown reader](https://www.zybuluo.com/mdeditor#fn:latex) ## 1. Title level ### level 3-0 #### level 4-0 ### level 3-1 #### level 4-1 #### level 4-2 ## 2. Insert a link. ### [Tim's Blog](https://timtingwei.github.io/) ### [Tim's Blog][2] ## 3. Highlight the code ```python @requires_authorization class SomeClass: pass if __name__ == '__main__': # A comment print 'hello world' ``` ```cpp #include class Foo { public: int f(); }; int main() { // ... return 0; } ``` ## 4. three lists of point ### Bulleted List > * first line > * second line > * third line ### Numbered List > 1. first line > 2. second line > 3. third line ### TODO list - [ ] first todo - [ ] second todo - [x] third todo -> Done ## 5. insert a note[^code] LaTex formula support [LaTex][^LaTex] high light code [code][^code] insert a web note [MathJax][1] ## 6. bold fonts ** bold fonts ** by adding two asteriskes * as prefix and suffix respectively ## 7. Reference > You can insert a reference by ">", and input enter to create a new line, This is the end line. Until the next symbol occur. ## 8. edit a formula $$E=mc^2$$ use $$ ## 9.draw a flow picture ```flow st=>start: Start op=>operation: Your Opreation cond=>condition: Yes or No? e=>end st->op->cond cond(yes)->e cond(no)->op ``` [^LaTex]: support **LaTex** edit and display, such as: $\sum_{i=1}^n a_i=0$, visit [MathJax][1] for more information. [^code]: include Java, Python, JavaScript etc. [1]: http://meta.math.stackexchange.com/questions/5020/mathjax-basic-tutorial-and-quick-reference [2]: https://timtingwei.github.io/ ------ # > * [](#) > * [](#) > * [](#) > * [](#) > * [](#) 20171224post ## \`gray background\` `gray background` \\, ## `[create an anchor](#anchors-in-markdown)` [create an anchor](#anchors-in-markdown) \=========== refwebsite: [Anchors in Markdown](https://gist.github.com/asabaylus/3071099) ### anchors in markdown skip into this title ## `~~~~` ~~~~ `~~` `~~` ~~ ~~ `~~[mituhs notes][timtingwei.github.io]~~` ~~\[mituhs notes\]\[timtingwei.github.io\]~~ ==== \========== refwebsite: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown ## `![Logo](/images/logo.png)` ![Logo](/images/logo.png) \=========== refwebsite: hexohttps://hexo.io/zh-cn/docs/asset-folders.html https://webapps.stackexchange.com/questions/29602/markdown-to-insert-and-display-an-image-on-github-repo ## `*This is Blue italic.*` *This is Blue italic.* `**This is Red Bold.**` **This is Red Bold.** , italic blod \=========== refwebsite: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35465557/how-to-apply-color-in-markdown ## next one ? --------------------------------------------------------------- markdown timtingwei#hotmail.com

Post.title: git bash
Post._content:
## issue:

.git
> C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 10.0\VC\bin\d3d

bashcd
```
$ cd C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 10.0\VC\bin\d3d
bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
```
bash

## hack:

> 1. CMD"regedit"
> 2.  HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Classes\Directory\Background\shell
> 3.  "shell"  New > Key. KEY "Bash"
> 4.  "open in Bash" 
> 5. KEY"command". git-bash.exe .

, Open in bash.

bashgit

------

reference:
[1]: https://www.zhihu.com/question/48091139 @Rowboat

Post.title: Git Push
Post._content:
## **.git-credentials**

```sh
$ cd
$ touch .git-credentials
$ emacs .git-credentials
https://{timting***}:{********}@github.com
```

```sh
$ cd ~/.emacs.d/
$ git push -u origin master
Username for 'https://github.com':   C-c C-c
```

**{}**

```sh
$ emacs ~/.git-credentials
https://timting***:********@github.com
$ git config --global credential.helper store

$ cd
$ cat ~/.gitconfig
[user]
	email = timtingwei@hotmail.com
	name = timtingwei
[credential]
	helper = store
```

push

****

```sh
$ ls -ld .git-credentials
-rw------- 1 tim tim 42 12 22 15:00 .git-credentials
tim@htwt:~$ sudo chmod 200 .git-credentials
[sudo] password for tim: 
tim@htwt:~$ ls -ld .git-credentials
--w------- 1 tim tim 42 12 22 15:00 .git-credentials
tim@htwt:~$ git config --global credential.helper store
```

bash

```sh
tim@htwt:~/.emacs.d$ git push origin master
fatal: unable to open /home/tim/.git-credentials: Permission denied
```

=> , , git

======

## **cache**
```sh
$ rm ~/.git-credentials
```
gitcachecache 

```sh
$ git config --global credential.helper cache
\# Set git to use the credential memory cache
```

```sh
$ git config --global credential.helper 'cache --timeout=3600'
\# Set the cache to timeout after 1 hour (setting is in seconds)
```
======

refwebsite:
[1], https://www.zhihu.com/question/31836445
[2], http://www.jianshu.com/p/f54053afecf2
[3], https://help.github.com/articles/caching-your-github-password-in-git/

Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

WindowsubuntuhexoWindowsubuntuhexo, github pages github

hexogithub
> 1. create a repo, push
> 2. git branchrepobranch


**git**
```sh
$ git --version

$ sudo apt-get install git-core
```
**npm(node package manager):**
```
$ npm --version

$ sudo apt-get install npm
```
**node-legacy**
[node-legacy][1]
```sh
$ sudo apt-get install nodejs-legacy
```

**nvm**
nvmnpmnode
```sh
$ wget -qO- https://raw.github.com/creationix/nvm/master/install.sh | sh
```

** Node.js**
> Node.jsJavaScriptJavaScriptNode.jsNode.jsLinuxNode.jsGoogleV8
visit [node.js][2] for more information
```sh
$ nvm install 4
```

** hexo**
```
$ npm install hexo-cli -g

$ npm install hexo -g
```

**git**

:
```sh
$ ls -al ~/.ssh
ls: cannot access /home/tim/.ssh: No such file or directory
```

:
```sh
$ ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "timtingwei@hotmail.com"
```

:
```sh
$ ssh-agent -s
```

:
```sh
$ ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_rsa
```

githubSHH KEY
```
$ clip < cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub
```
github settingshh key

```sh
$ ssh -T git@github.com
Hi timtingwei! You've successfully authenticated, but GitHub does not provide shell access.
```

**git branchhexo**
[CrazyMilk][3]

> 1. repo, timtingwei.github.io;
> 2. masterhexohexo, master;
> 3. repo setting hexo;
> 4. git clone git@github.com:timtingwei/timtingwei.github.io.git repo;
> 5. npm install hexohexo initnpm install  npm install hexo-deployer-githexo;hexo init;
> 6. _config.ymldeploy::branchmaster;
> 7.  git add., git commit -m "...", git push origin hexo ;
> 8. hexo g -d github
> 9. :7,8.

, hexo s
```sh
$ hexo server
INFO  Start processing
```

hexo 3.0hexo-server
```sh
$ npm install hexo-server --save

$ hexo server
```
, 

****, publichexo generate
```sh
$ hexo generate
$ hexo server -s
INFO  Start processing
INFO  Hexo is running at http://localhost:4000/. Press Ctrl+C to stop.
```

**GLFW/GLFW3**
GLFWOpenGLCOpenGL

GLFW[][6]

[How to build & install GLFW 3 and use it in a Linux project][3]
,

```sh
$ sudo apt-get install cmake

$ cmake -G "Unix Makefiles"

$ sudo apt-get build-dep glfw
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.

$ sudo make
$ sudo make install

Install the project...
-- Install configuration: ""
-- Installing: /usr/local/include/GLFW
-- Installing: /usr/local/include/GLFW/glfw3.h
-- Installing: /usr/local/include/GLFW/glfw3native.h
-- Installing: /usr/local/lib/cmake/glfw3/glfw3Config.cmake
-- Installing: /usr/local/lib/cmake/glfw3/glfw3ConfigVersion.cmake
-- Installing: /usr/local/lib/cmake/glfw3/glfw3Targets.cmake
-- Installing: /usr/local/lib/cmake/glfw3/glfw3Targets-noconfig.cmake
-- Installing: /usr/local/lib/pkgconfig/glfw3.pc
-- Installing: /usr/local/lib/libglfw3.a
```

**[][4]**
#include <GLFW/glfw3.h>


```sh
$ g++ -std=c++11 -c main.cpp

$ ./main.o
bash: ./main.o: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error  <==main.o


$ g++ main.o -o main.exec -lGL -lGLU -lglfw3 -lX11 -lXxf86vm -lXrandr -lpthread -lXi
/usr/bin/ld: //usr/local/lib/libglfw3.a(vulkan.c.o): undefined reference to symbol 'dlclose@@GLIBC_2.2.5'
//lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdl.so.2: error adding symbols: DSO missing from command line
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
```

You may also need to add the linker options -ldl -lXinerama -lXcursor to get it to work correctly if you are getting undefined references to **dlclose**

```sh
$ g++ main.o -o main.exec -lGL -lGLU -lglfw3 -lX11 -lXxf86vm -lXrandr -lpthread -lXi -ldl -lXinerama -lXcursor

$ ./main.exec
```
